meanings.definition: Capable of being reduced in size or length.
meanings.sent1: The suitcase was so contractible that it easily fit in the overhead compartment.
meanings.sent2: The blanket was contractible, allowing it to be folded neatly and stored away.
meanings.sent3: The contractible rubber band made a funny noise when stretched to its limit.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as contractible as a spring, ready to snap at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The balloon animals were created using contractible balloons that could be twisted into various shapes.

meanings.definition: Able to be made smaller or more compact.
meanings.sent1: The furniture in the room was contractible, making it easy to rearrange.
meanings.sent2: The telescope was contractible, allowing it to be stored in a small bag for travel.
meanings.sent3: The contractible puzzle pieces were challenging to put together in the right order.
meanings.sent4: His ego was as contractible as a deflating balloon, shrinking with each criticism.
meanings.sent5: The artist used contractible clay to sculpt intricate details in the miniature figurines.
